pageTitle: Fish Tacos with Walnut Slaw Recipe - California Walnuts

textBeforeTable: Entrees Course Dinner , Lunch Meal 4 People Serves 20 Mins Active Time 30 Mins Cook Time 50 Mins Total Time Tips: Walnut slaw can be made a day ahead and kept refrigerated. May use haddock or catfish instead of tilapia. Divide equally between the tortillas and top evenly with walnut slaw. Slice tilapia fillets into 1-inch pieces and season with salt and pepper. In a heavy bottomed nonstick pan on medium-high heat, add oil and pan-fry tilapia pieces until cooked and flaky, about 5 to 7 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine all walnut slaw ingredients. Mix well and set aside for 30 minutes. Directions 8 flour or corn tortillas, small 2 tablespoons olive oil 1/4-1/2 teaspoon pepper 1/4-1/2 teaspoon sea salt 4 tilapia fillets Fish Pinch of red pepper flakes 1/2 teaspoon onion powder 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 1 teaspoon mustard powder 1 teaspoon celery salt 1 tablespoon honey 2 spring onions, thinly sliced 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar 3 tablespoons
